comments.author: LpSolit@gmail.com
comments.text: Using Firefox 5 beta, I wanted to check if an update was available. There was! But the file to download was 14 Mb, and so I wanted to leave the "About Firefox" popup in the background while it's downloading the update. But clicking in a page gives the page the focus, but the "About Firefox" popup remains in front of it. I didn't want to close the popup in case this stopped the download. I think clicking somewhere in another page should not only give it the focus, but also put the "About Firefox" popup in the background.

Bug 608934 turned this modal dialog into a normal window on Linux, so it should be able to stay open in the background now (this change is only on Nightly right now).

However, this is something that still affects Windows, so we may want to make this change there as well. I think this may be a dupe of another bug, but I can't find it at the moment.
